meanings.definition: To surpass in daring or boldness.
meanings.sent1: She outdared all her friends by jumping off the high dive first.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outdare his classmates by doing the most daring stunts.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel outdared the big dog by climbing to the very top of the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outdare her fears was like a bright light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The knight's bravery outdared any challenge that came his way.

meanings.definition: To challenge someone to a daring act.
meanings.sent1: He decided to outdare his brother to see who could climb the highest.
meanings.sent2: She would often outdare her friends to try new adventurous activities.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would outdare each other to see who could hold their breath the longest.
meanings.sent4: The daredevil outdared his rival to perform the most dangerous stunt.
meanings.sent5: The explorer outdared his team to cross the treacherous river.

meanings.definition: To be more daring than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdare her friends by suggesting more daring adventures.
meanings.sent2: He would outdare his colleagues by proposing the riskiest strategies.
meanings.sent3: The young acrobat outdared his mentor by attempting a new, daring routine.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outdare her competitors was evident in every competition.
meanings.sent5: The artist outdared his critics by creating bold and unconventional artwork.
